Work and Purpose

Introduction

Work is more than just a way to earn a living; it is a divine calling and a vital part of the Christian life. God created us to be productive and purposeful, and work is a means of serving Him and others.

“Whatever you do, work heartily, as for the Lord and not for men.”
— Colossians 3:23
“Work is a divine appointment and should be regarded as a sacred trust.”
— Education, p. 234

Understanding our purpose through work helps us glorify God and fulfill His plan.

Work as Worship and Service

Work done with the right heart attitude is a form of worship. It reflects our gratitude to God and our desire to bless others.

“Let the thief no longer steal, but rather let him labor, doing honest work with his own hands.”
— Ephesians 4:28
“In order to glorify God, man must work.”
— Education, p. 231

Every honest task, done faithfully, is honorable in God’s sight.

Purpose and Calling

Each Christian has a unique purpose and gifts to serve God’s kingdom. Discovering and embracing this calling brings joy and fulfillment.

“The parable of the talents teaches us to use our abilities productively.”
— Matthew 25:14–30
“God has given each one his work… not only to earn a livelihood but to develop character and fit for heaven.”
— Christ’s Object Lessons, p. 346

Purposeful work builds character and prepares us for eternal reward.

Balancing Work and Rest

God instituted the Sabbath as a time of rest and spiritual renewal.

“Remember the sabbath day, to keep it holy... the seventh day is the sabbath of the Lord thy God.”
— Exodus 20:8–11

While work is important, so is rest and worship.

“True rest is rest in Jesus, a resting of the mind and soul upon the Lord.”
— The Desire of Ages, p. 330

Christians should balance diligence with the Sabbath principle, avoiding overwork and burnout. Proper rest rejuvenates us to serve God more effectively.

Work as Witness

Our work ethic and attitude witness to the world about Christ’s transforming power.

“By your good conduct… let them see your good works and glorify God.”
— 1 Peter 2:12
“The honest, diligent laborer will win the respect of his fellowmen and a crown of life from his Master.”
— Education, p. 235

Through work, we demonstrate integrity, faithfulness, and God’s love, attracting others to Christ.

Conclusion

Work is a sacred calling that blends service, worship, and purpose. When done with the right heart, it builds character, glorifies God, and impacts others for eternity.

“The blessing of God rests upon the faithful laborer.”
— Education, p. 232

Let us embrace our work as part of God’s plan, working joyfully and faithfully for His glory.
